name: "Domination" | "PRISON" COLLECTION
description:
No. 636
“Go and die, go and die,
The handsome King satisfy
For the Lord when you die
Your glories multiply.”
Rumi 
Size: 16000px X 16000px
___________

In the "Prison" collection, the contrast between the senses of freedom and suffocation is addressed. And in the corner of each of the 3D arts of this abstract collection, a verse from the lyric No. 636 of Rumi is written.
This poem is about the mystical concept of "dying before dying" which is one of the important concepts in Rumi's thought. The first "death" refers to the separation from all worldly belongings and carnal and human dependencies, which means entering the first stage of conduct. But the second "death" is real death and the end of life.
